types.section:
{{fr-noun|f}}

# French [[fish]] dish consisting of [[sole#English|sole]], preferably whole (gray skin removed) or [[filet]], that is [[dredge]]d in [[flour]], [[pan fry|pan fried]] in butter and served with the resulting [[brown sauce|brown butter sauce]], [[parsley]] and [[lemon]].
types.html:
sole meunière f (plural soles meunières)

  1. French fish dish consisting of sole, preferably whole (gray skin removed) or filet, that is dredged in flour, pan fried in butter and served with the resulting brown butter sauce, parsley and lemon.
trans: French fish dish consisting of sole, preferably whole  or filet, that is dredged in flour, pan fried in butter and served with the resulting brown butter sauce, parsley and lemon.
French fish dish consisting of sole, preferably whole  or filet, that is dredged in flour, pan fried in butter and served with the resulting brown butter sauce, parsley and lemon.

title: sole meunière
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /sɔl mœ.njɛʁ/
